Overall%20Experience.Review: I am absolutely irrate with the police.. why ticket someone for a "rolling stop" at the stop sign. When the students going around with their scooters and bicycles no helmet on no light no reflectors day or night. i mean make it fair strict rule for everyone.. even if a car is going 25mph its difficult to navigate through all the annoying roundabouts and tight roads. Now add hundreds of careless pedestrians on 2 wheels. Stanford needs to get their act together and discipline/ticket them too. I will never visit or study here ever
Overall%20Experience.Author: Other

Overall%20Experience.Review: My time at Stanford was amazing! The motto "the winds of freedom blow" perfectly encapsulates the expansive educational opportunities from world class professors to accessible professionals to vast research opportunities. The flexibility of the curriculum made it easy to be explority at any point in my college experience. I also had great opportunity to expand and explore socially and in hobbies with so many clubs and interest groups! I joined an acapella group, grew in my faith in Chi Alpha Christian Fellowship, and developed skill and endurance with the Pickleball Club! I would love to see greater opportunities for upperclassmen and lowerclassmen to interact in fun social, non party related, ways. Having a central campus hangout spot with games and activities would be amazing!
Overall%20Experience.Author: Alum

Overall%20Experience.Review: I enjoyed my time at Stanford overall but my main issue is with the administration. Their actions show they truly do not care about the students. I never felt supported by them and knew that any chance they had to disregard the student opinion or voice they took it.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Alum

Overall%20Experience.Review: Stanford is  undoubtedly amazing, for the incredible people, beautiful campus, and boundless opportunity.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Graduate Student

Overall%20Experience.Review: Vibrant and fun culture, intellectually diverse and rigorous place, clubs and people are friendly but local area is very suburban/wealthy/boring
Overall%20Experience.Author: Senior

Overall%20Experience.Review: The school is incredible. Coming here has been the best decision I have made. Meeting so many new people has been great, and the professors really do care how you are doing and are very approachable. However, campus can feel dead a lot of times because on the weekends, it is usually only frat parties, and they are required to end at 1 a.m. every time.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Sophomore

Overall%20Experience.Review: The author praises Stanford for its collaborative and innovative environment, world-class faculty, and innovative programs like d.school workshops. They appreciate the strong sense of community and intellectual curiosity. However, they suggest areas for improvement, such as enhancing mental health resources and supporting underrepresented groups, especially in STEM fields, for equitable access to resources.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Freshman

Overall%20Experience.Review: Amazing school but one thing I would change about this school is that I would fund the sports and athletics more and hire a new head coach for the football team
Overall%20Experience.Author: Other

Overall%20Experience.Review: I love going to stanford. Everybody there is so nice and smart and thereâ€™s so much to do. Some professors are scary but the material is good.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Sophomore

Overall%20Experience.Review: For me, the greatest challenge thus far at Stanford has been choosing which opportunities to pursue, simply due to the insane number of them open to students. They span rigorous academic endeavors, such as research under the supervision of pioneers of entire fields to engaging passionately with student bodies on campus and the greater bay community, to developing deep, meaningful relationships with peers. 24 hours feels too short to enjoy it all, but that is truly a spoiled problem to have. Despite academics being rigorous and challenging, I feel that there is ample support although, you need to be proactive about it as an individual student.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Junior

Overall%20Experience.Review: I loved attending the school, but I did feel like there could have been stronger administrative support for students
Overall%20Experience.Author: Alum

Overall%20Experience.Review: As a freshman, my experience is limited. However, even in my brief time here, I am astounded by the classes and my classmates alike. I like in a dorm with olympians, olympiad winners, chess masters, and people of incredible level in every field imaginable. My classes are pushing me in a way that I have never experienced, and I look forward to the coming years. Obviously the name Stanford speaks for itself, but make sure that it has the programs/qualities that you would genuinely enjoy if you plan to attend.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Freshman

Overall%20Experience.Review: I took classes during a summer and really enjoyed my time there. I loved the campus and many of the buildings I used were great. I loved the non-caf food options as well, but the cafeteria itself could use additional food options. I'd love to see more vegetarian options that weren't just steamed vegetables.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Other

Overall%20Experience.Review: I love it yet also hate it here. I have a love-hate relationship with Stanford. #proudtree #takemebackhomethough
Overall%20Experience.Author: Junior

Overall%20Experience.Review: I love my time at Stanford. I'm a transfer student, and it's so much different from where I transferred from. I love the diversity here, the way the professors are really good at teaching, and student life as a whole. My friends are so inspiring and it feels great to be surrounded with the greatest minds coming from all around the world.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Sophomore

Overall%20Experience.Review: I appreciate the diverse community, beautiful campus, and various extracurricular activities that are offered on campus.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Junior

Overall%20Experience.Review: I think Stanford is a great place for people from any background to grow. Something I really appreciate about the university is access to resources, and the true care people have to ensuring that you grow a lot as an individual.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Senior

Overall%20Experience.Review: My experience at Stanford University has been incredibly enriching and transformative. I loved the vibrant intellectual environment, where curiosity and critical thinking are highly encouraged. The faculty are not only leaders in their fields but are also approachable and genuinely invested in students' learning and growth. The diverse range of courses and extracurricular opportunities allowed me to explore my interests deeply, from international relations to music composition, and to engage in meaningful research and internships that broadened my perspective.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Senior

Overall%20Experience.Review: I loved Stanford's amazing facilities for making and prototyping and funding for students in the arts. As a senior, I had the opportunity to study in New York and work at a paid internship, which ultimately led to my dream job offer!
Overall%20Experience.Author: Alum

Overall%20Experience.Review:
I'm an alum, parent of an alum, & worked in a significant position at Stanford.
I loved meeting brilliant people from around the world. As a result, I learned a tremendous amount in academic & social interactions. Stanford provided opportunities to meet world leaders, policy makers, artists, scientists, & people that pushed the envelope in a variety of industries. It allowed me space to grow, change directions, and then supported me once a path was chosen. Financial aid was easy to work with; I had outside scholarships but still had to work on campus. During my daughter's time they offered significant awards to families, which was a huge relief.  
Due to the qtr system, I took a ton of classes so I double majored. My daughter was Phi Beta Kappa as she also took classes in different disciplines.
I walked on to athletic teams & by my last year was playing with a US team. That had a significant impact on my life. 
Campus is amazing! 8000 acres with the farm, gardens, museums, hiking, etc.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Alum

Overall%20Experience.Review: Stanford is an amazing place to find dedicated, unique individuals all equipped with and eagerness to change the world!
Overall%20Experience.Author: Junior

Overall%20Experience.Review: Overall, a transformative experience that led to positive growth as a person, encouraging independence and academic success.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Senior

Overall%20Experience.Review: Overall, I really enjoyed my time at Stanford, even during the pandemic. The quality of my academic instruction, my ability to participate in a range of extracurriculars, and the depth of my friendships were outstanding. Being a large school and a research institution, it can feel like there is not much personal care from administration, and there is a large push to be high achieving and productive all the time.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Alum

Overall%20Experience.Review: Stanford is a good place to learn how to be independent and work hard towards a career. You'll also find great friends to hang out with and explore the Bay Area together.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Senior

Overall%20Experience.Review:
Stanford University offers an exceptional academic environment with cutting-edge research opportunities and a vibrant campus life. The access to world-renowned faculty and a diverse, intellectually stimulating community are definite highlights. The collaborative atmosphere fosters innovation and personal growth.

However, some areas for improvement could include increasing support for mental health services and addressing issues of diversity and inclusion more robustly. Additionally, enhancing financial aid programs to ensure broader accessibility for students from all economic backgrounds would be beneficial.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Freshman

Overall%20Experience.Review:
Academic programs, resources, and community are as strong as anyone would expect
Social life, housing, and quality of professors in some departments leave room for improvement (some departments are great through)
Overall%20Experience.Author: Sophomore

Overall%20Experience.Review: Stanford has been a great experience so far. I went through a bit of a rough patch early in my freshman year but once I became acclimated, I fell in love with the school and Northern California in general. Campus is absolutely beautiful and I would say that there is something going on ninety percent of the time. Most people are down to earth, good human beings who are genuine and pleasant to be around. I would like to see the dining situation change; myself and many other included believe that it is flawed and that unused dining swipes should be turned into dining dollars, portions should be larger, etc. Overall, however, Stanford is an amazing place.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Sophomore

Overall%20Experience.Review: Stanford is an amazing school that really does have so much to offer. The student body is incredibly diverse and the professors are quite simply the best!
Overall%20Experience.Author: Alum

Overall%20Experience.Review:
Attending Stanford has been a mix of excitement and challenges. Going to games is a blast, with plenty of sports activities. Professors are generally great but lean politically one way, limiting viewpoint diversity. As a research-focused institution, one-on-one time with professors is limited, though humanities professors are more approachable. Lecturers are decent, reflecting the research emphasis.

Campus life can be slow, so finding your group is crucial. The campus is huge and beautiful, with great weather and all necessary amenities. The social scene is limited, and Palo Alto, though affluent, is not very exciting. San Francisco and Oakland are 45 minutes to an hour away, offering more entertainment options. However, most students stay on campus due to the distance and heavy workload, contributing to the "Stanford bubble." Overall, Stanford offers great opportunities, but you need to find your niche to make the most of it.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Graduate Student

Overall%20Experience.Review: Stanford University offers exceptional academics, cutting-edge research opportunities, and a vibrant campus life. The diverse community and stunning campus make it an ideal place for personal and academic growth.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Freshman

Overall%20Experience.Review: I grew more than I ever thought possible as a student at Stanford University. It's not perfectâ€”nowhere isâ€”but it was one of the richest, most valuable environments I've ever been in.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Alum

Overall%20Experience.Review: I like the atmosphere that the university overall brings. I think a lot of people of different background could very well adapt and accommodate themselves easily here but if course it depends on the personality that that person brings to the table. So far, I would like for some of the housing especially for international students change.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Sophomore

Overall%20Experience.Review: I honestly really like it here! It was my dream school and genuinely there are so many opportunities that you have access to. That said, its heat you make of it. No one will force you or push you to apply for things or cold email people. You just need to have the personal drive. Also, I love the area, its quiet, so if you're into big massive part vibes, it may not be the place for you. I love how they have options for weekends for people who don't party. Very accommodating!
Overall%20Experience.Author: Freshman

Overall%20Experience.Review: It was amazing touring, the people, culture and local surroundings. By far the Bay Area is the most beautiful in the world in my opinion and Stanford reflects it culture and standing
Overall%20Experience.Author: Other

Overall%20Experience.Review: The academic rigor combined with the serene, on-campus social life is a nice contrast to the fun-loving and humble student body. In general, the students at Stanford love the beautiful campus and the professors, although at the top of their respective fields, are open to any student walking in and striking a conversation.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Freshman

Overall%20Experience.Review: I find that the university is lacking in skill to teach and overall help students, I talked to my professor and he purposely avoided me and said that he was to busy to deal with me
Overall%20Experience.Author: Other

Overall%20Experience.Review: My first year at Stanford has been absolutely incredible! The campus is just stunning!! And the best part? It's super safe, which is a big deal for me as an international student. Whenever I'm back on campus, it's like a breath of fresh air, like coming home. And remember, Stanford is seriously loaded with resources. I couldn't imagine experiencing college anywhere else.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Freshman

Overall%20Experience.Review: I love Stanford's uniqueness and biology courses! However, I think it would be great if they adjusted their financial study courses.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Other

Overall%20Experience.Review: Stanford was incredible for me - it shifted my perspectives, made me a better scholar and human being, and is where I made all my most valuable friendships (even now, 4 years out). My Stanford community is my most important community!
Overall%20Experience.Author: Alum

Overall%20Experience.Review: So cool but spoken about to often by non potentials with basic thoughts of mind that cannot leave that school alone sometime
Overall%20Experience.Author: Other

Overall%20Experience.Review: My experience at Stanford University was incredibly enriching and transformative. The academic rigor challenged me to push my boundaries and think critically in diverse fields of study. The vibrant campus culture fostered deep connections with peers and faculty, sparking countless engaging discussions and collaborations. The resources and opportunities available, from research initiatives to extracurricular activities, were unparalleled, allowing me to pursue my interests and passions fully. However, I believe there's room for improvement in terms of diversity and inclusion efforts, ensuring that all students feel equally supported and represented within the Stanford community. Additionally, enhancing accessibility to resources for students from various socioeconomic backgrounds would further enrich the university experience for all.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Sophomore

Overall%20Experience.Review: It really sucked. People were rude. Teachers sucked. Campus was good but not many places to eat at. Bad neighborhood.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Graduate Student

Overall%20Experience.Review: My experience at Stanford University has been transformative. I have gained invaluable knowledge ,skills, and connections that will undoubtedly shape my future.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Freshman

Overall%20Experience.Review: Stanford University is a highly motivated environment with students and faculty from all around the world, giving the school an unmatchable unique perspective. Those who attend Stanford are driven and the future leaders of the world, however students are generally friendly and humble despite their incredible achievements.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Freshman

Overall%20Experience.Review: The academic rigor is what you would expect from a college of this status. Professors are accommodating but still not cover you to do the majority of the work in terms of learning. If you apply yourself you will do well. Free tutoring, office hours and feedback is constantly and consistently available to everyone. Some things that could change is community. There are a lot of students that feel disconnected to everyone around them. Traditions have faded over recent years and stricter policies have limited student engagement. This is a great school, beautiful but not very diverse. Find yourself before you look for someone else.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Sophomore

Overall%20Experience.Review: The first year at Stanford was incredibly enjoyable, especially for those with intellectual curiosity, given the abundance of opportunities across various interests. While the engineering school is popular, Stanford isn't solely focused on engineering, as confirmed by others not in that field. I particularly appreciate the diverse range of activities available, from engaging extracurriculars and sports to vibrant parties and valuable work opportunities. Personally, I regularly enjoyed activities like surfing at the excellent spots in Santa Cruz, about an hour off-campus, and hiking in the picturesque hills nearby. Questions about controversial topics like the "prohibited words list" did come up, but, in reality, it had and continues to have no impact on campus life. Overall, I wholeheartedly recommend Stanford to anyone and everyone.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Alum

Overall%20Experience.Review: I transferred to Stanford in September of 2021 I major in Theatre and Performance Studies with a Concentration in Acting.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Senior

Overall%20Experience.Review:
I applied to Stanford University with no expectations. I did not know until I had already gotten in that it was one of the top academic institutions in the country, if not the world. And that intimidated me, quite frankly. 

I'm not the smartest person in the world. I'm pretty much average in terms of intellect and personality. I was actually confused as to how I got into this school. Imposter Syndrome hit me like a truck: "Would I even be able to hold my own at a school where everyone is gifted? What if I don't belong here?"

But then I met my Resident Assistant and my Japanese instructors. A lot of the worries I felt began to crumble. They encouraged me that even those at an institution like Stanford are not always going to excel at everything all of the time. It is perfectly okay to have some setbacks. The important thing, they assured me, was that I learned from those experiences and do better next time.

I didn't expect to go to California for school, but I'm glad I did.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Sophomore

Overall%20Experience.Review: Overall I think Stanford University offers a solid undergraduate experience. I would like to see more direct support of undergraduates in the form of quality advising, outreach, etc., as well as more health services offered to students and staff.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Alum

Overall%20Experience.Review: I loved connecting with other bright and well minded students. The faculty is extremely helpful and always want you to succeed. The resources here is immense and always within reach
Overall%20Experience.Author: Sophomore

Overall%20Experience.Review: Really enjoyable first year. Perfect for intellectually curious people as there are a lot of opportunities for all interests. Engineering school is popular but definitely not just an engineering school as I have heard from others who are not at Stanford. I really love the combination of things to do including great extracurricular activities, sports, parties, and work opportunities. Something that I did regularly was go surfing at the great spots about an hour off campus in Santa Cruz, or go hiking in the hills around campus. I was often asked about things like the "prohibited words list" that gained traction in the media and kicked up a lot of different opinions. If that is something you are worried about, it had and continues to have no bearing on campus life whatsoever. Overall, I would recommend it to anyone and everyone.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Freshman

Overall%20Experience.Review:
- Nice students, very friendly 
- Flake culture sucked
- Great academics
- Lovely weather
- Amazing campus
- Campus was a bit too big, required a bike
- Lots of extracurriculars
- I thought it would be much more competitive than it was, which was nice
Overall%20Experience.Author: Alum

Overall%20Experience.Review: Stanford has a beautiful campus and has some great programs. It can be difficult to get off campus, and the closest cities are very expensive, like Palo Alto.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Alum

Overall%20Experience.Review: Stanford is an exceptional university filled with lots of brilliant and passionate students, which can be really intimidating at first and it's almost impossible to convince yourself that you're one of them. However, the opportunities on campus only matter as much as you take advantage of them. Like any school, there will be some students in every class that you don't want to be best friends with, but overall it's a great community. Palo Alto is definitely not a college town, though, and the expensive restaurants and old white men bars are not the most fun to go off campus. However, most people don't need to go off campus much, if at all. Everything you need is within the large campus, which is a big bubble, but a special one. Stanford is not immune to common issues at schools like sub-par mental health programs, work-in-progress transparency from the Board and leadership on touchy or divisive issues, etc. However, people are passionate about trying to change it for the better.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Alum

Overall%20Experience.Review: The community and campus are beautiful. The university if filled with a great diversity of histories that I am awed by every time I hear about them. One thing that I would like to improve about the university is the teaching quality of some professors, as they are not trained to teach as high school or grade school teachers are. In addition, the inconsistency of grading across courses is something that is upsetting to experience.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Freshman

Overall%20Experience.Review: Stanford churns out the best of the best -  from olympic athletes to nobel laureates. Throw in a beautiful campus and terrifc weather and no other university in the world comes close.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Senior

Overall%20Experience.Review: I really enjoyed it. Amazing school, so academically competitive and so much opportunity to explore and find new ways of seeing the world.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Freshman

Overall%20Experience.Review: I attended for about 2.5 years before taking a leave of absence; I've returned this spring to finish my degree. I am happy to report that the things I previously appreciated about this school have stayed: financial aid, focus on diversity, and pursuit of intellectual curiosity. There are also things that have improved, such as administration's customer service. And, on top of it all, we are able to appreciate a beautiful campus that is saturated with a variety of trees, flowers, and shrubbery that house a similarly large variety of birds.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Junior

Overall%20Experience.Review: I had a great experience at Stanford. The professors are incredibly engaged and the students are so passionate about such a variety of subjects. I really appreciated how many options there were for extracurricular activities as well.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Alum

Overall%20Experience.Review:
As a former student of Stanford University, I can say with confidence that it was an incredible experience. The campus is absolutely beautiful, with stunning architecture and sprawling gardens that make for a peaceful and serene environment to study in.

The professors were all experts in their fields and incredibly knowledgeable. They pushed us to think critically and creatively, challenging us to go beyond the textbook and truly understand the material. The classes were engaging and interactive, with lots of opportunities for discussion and collaboration.

One thing that stood out to me about Stanford was the emphasis on interdisciplinary studies. The university encourages students to explore different fields and take classes outside of their major, which I found to be incredibly valuable. It allowed me to broaden my knowledge and perspectives, and I still use the skills I learned in those classes today. This university is amazing and extremely beneficial to your future career
Overall%20Experience.Author: Niche User

Overall%20Experience.Review: Stanford is full of bright minded students motivated to be their best and create a better future for the world.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Alum

Overall%20Experience.Review: As a low income student, Stanford was jarring in some ways. They lack the resources and the community to properly support students for disadvantaged backgrounds. I had a wonderful time at Stanford and I met some of my best friends there, but that does not take away from the fact that the experience was often an uphill battle.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Alum

Overall%20Experience.Review: The campus is beautiful, and most people find a group of people they really thrive with. World-renowned professors with varying levels of interest in your personal growth.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Alum

Overall%20Experience.Review:
I overall had a great experience. I majored in Religious Studies and Philosophy and had excellent professors and classes. But, I do think that Stanford could do more to support its humanities departments overall; although the school clearly spends the money and puts the effort into getting excellent faculty, the way that humanities department programs are run could be improved. The programs often don't have 'core' requirements in the same way STEM classes do, and upper level classes don't get treated with the same rigor that STEM classes do.  All of this together made the humanities feel second to STEM, and intellectuality took second place to entrepreneurship.
At the end of the day, I enjoyed my time: I made great friends, I loved the campus, I got a good academic foundation, and walked away with a highly sought after degree.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Alum

Overall%20Experience.Review: Very good access to opportunities but intense school life especially when a student athlete. Social life gets bad press but it's very enjoyable and a beautiful campus. Surrounding area is expensive but there is a lot to do off campus.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Freshman

Overall%20Experience.Review: I would recommend others to visit, the campus is great, the professors take time for you if you have any questions. There are fortune 500 companies all around you ready to hire so the job scene is great
Overall%20Experience.Author: Niche User

Overall%20Experience.Review: The campus is beautiful and there are a lot of resources for first-generation and low-income students.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Freshman

Overall%20Experience.Review: Great experience. Being surrounded by motivated individuals is a highly valuable characteristic for any school to have.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Niche User

Overall%20Experience.Review: Stanford hates fun. Classes were overrated and I never received the college experience that I wanted cause admin cracked down on everything from parties to the food we loved to the sports teams.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Senior

Overall%20Experience.Review: I like Stanford University because of it teaching activities and academics,it compound is very neat.Another thing you're going to love about Stanford is the campus. There are so many beautiful spots to study. One of my favorite things about Stanford is the nature of the people. Everyone is friendly, excited, collaborative, and supportive of all other students
Overall%20Experience.Author: Niche User

Overall%20Experience.Review: Stanford is a beautiful and rich school that incorporates both diversity and a wide range of programs and majors.  The weather is perfect and the campus is a perfect place for biking, walking, and running. Stanford not only is one of the most prestigous schools in the country but it's a school that engaged and interactive. At Stanford they want students to recieve the necessary support and assistance. Everyone is serious and hardworking, all striving for success and greatness.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Niche User

Overall%20Experience.Review:
Too many opportunities. Hard to not want to engage in all what is at offer!
People here are what make a difference.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Freshman

Overall%20Experience.Review: Stanford is a great and prestigious school, and I would say I gave it a 4-star rating just for the Psychology department alone. They also have really good need-based aid for their first-generation and/or low-income students (A.K.A., me!) However, it is only 4 stars because, at an administration level, I believe some changes need to be made. There is not enough being done for marginalized folks or survivors of sexual harassment and assault. Oftentimes, the university overlooks crimes that take place involving these individuals and aims to push them under the rug. In addition, services like CAPS and Sexual Health Education need more funding and to be expanded. They are overflowing with people who need care but there are not enough providers and educators to go around. Moreover, I believe there is a call for Stanford to protect their students as well as faculty, actually showing they care for students' physical, mental, and emotional well-being, not just their success.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Senior

Overall%20Experience.Review: I went to Stanford Summer Session 2022 and it was one of my favorite summers. I grew as a person and discovered some of my passions.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Niche User

Overall%20Experience.Review: Stanford has excellent teachers, academics, and overall experience. Sometimes it can be difficult to communicate with the professors or TAs, which would be one thing that could be improved upon.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Junior

Overall%20Experience.Review: Stanford has developed a reputation as one of the country's great institutions of higher education, consistently ranking in the top 10 national universities. In addition to outstanding academics, Stanford is known for its great return on investment and entrepreneurial student body.This marks the second year in a row that Stanford is the most selective college in the country, a title that was traditionally held by Harvard until last year. Stanford accepted 2,138 of the 42,167 student applicants for the Class of 2018They come from diverse backgrounds, both academically and ethnically. Students are optimistic, fun, and intellectual. Bright, creative, career-oriented, friendly, socially liberal and relaxed. Students at Stanford come from around the world and will likely be some of the most interesting people you will ever meet.Stanford is among the world's leading research and teaching universities. It aspires not only to provide education but also to develop individuals.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Sophomore

Overall%20Experience.Review: Stanford's greatest strengths are its supportive community, cutting-edge research facilities, and opportunities to interact with professionals who are leaders in their field.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Senior

Overall%20Experience.Review: The education is fantastic. In general professors are eager to talk to you and assist you. The connections you will make among students and faculty are invaluable assets. However, as is with most PWIs there is a very pronounced overrepresentation of white men on faculty.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Graduate Student

Overall%20Experience.Review: This is the place where you will learn, the contest is always with yourself. Your voice is as important as the next. A place to make an impact, and create your own track.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Freshman

Overall%20Experience.Review: Amazing world class education! I love the studious environment and the strive for excellence! This feels like home.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Freshman

Overall%20Experience.Review: It was really pretty and all the student were really nice and helpful, nothing needed to change, it was really good
Overall%20Experience.Author: Niche User

Overall%20Experience.Review: Stanford is an amalgamation of not only innovative, but driven, unique, and passionate students. It is cliche, but the people make you want to grow and learn as much as the outstanding academics. The professors are extremely intelligent and want to see their classes succeed. "Introsems" allow you to form one-on-one relationships with leaders in every field. Not to mention, the campus sits in the middle of Silicon Valley, leading to endless career and extracurricular opportunities. Arguably, the largest return on investment comes from the connections you form with a tight-knit and widespread network of successful alumni. Stanford students are set up for success.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Sophomore

Overall%20Experience.Review: The academics are fun and research is great. The point of Stanford being an enticing choice is that the introduction of the Knight Heaney scholarship scheme which is diverse and provides services beyond our capabilities
Overall%20Experience.Author: Niche User

Overall%20Experience.Review:
The best part of Stanford is the people and fellow students. Within a year here, I have already made friends and bonds that I know will last a lifetime. 

Because of the three-quarter systemâ€”instead of the semester systemâ€”, you get to explore more classes that interest you, which gives you more opportunities to discover what your major might be and to take classes outside your major.

Another amazing aspect is the food and the dining hall. There are several amazing dining halls on campus that you have access to that offer delicious and healthy food that rivals some professional 5-star restaurants.

One thing I would change I would like to change is the amount you have to do to join most clubs and groups on campus. While there are many that do not require you to do much to join, the vast majority require you to try out, do long applications and interviews, etc. This prevents a lot of people from pursuing interests and feeling bound to a group, even if they want to leave.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Freshman

Overall%20Experience.Review: There are many good things about Stanford, from the warm California weather to the phenomenal classes. What I like about Stanford the most, is their diverse community of thinkers from all over the world that always have enriching ideas and experiences to share. It's common to have strange arguments in the dorm halls, but the most memorable to me was "does being Jewish and gay make someone Kosher?" I also love fountain hopping or studying late in Huang Engineering basement.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Sophomore

Overall%20Experience.Review: Stanford is an absolute dream. From application to graduation, Stanford has a unique spirit and support system that makes every studentâ€™s college experience phenomenal.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Freshman

Overall%20Experience.Review: More difficult to find a sense of community and professional opportunities in the humanities/visual arts; however, this has greatly improved since I first enrolled. Beautiful and safe campus but not the ideal "college town." Little nightlife and affordable leisure.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Alum

Overall%20Experience.Review: I love Stanford and it's a great school to thrive academically and socially where one can thrive in a challenging, but fun environment!
Overall%20Experience.Author: Freshman

Overall%20Experience.Review: What I like about Stanford are the doors it will open up and the many opportunities the school provides to discover more about what you want to spend the rest of your life doing. I would advise making a very good (it doesn't have to be a big) group of friends.  This will really help to cement your college experiences.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Sophomore

Overall%20Experience.Review: The reputation, has a legacy that want many students be part of the university, their awesome campus, academy and more. I absolutely love Stanford. It's an amazing community of intellectually engaged and passionate students. One of my favorite things about Stanford is the nature of the people. Everyone is friendly, excited, collaborative, and supportive of all other students, and everyone works hard to make it a diverse and inclusive place. I have met life-long friends while at Stanford. In addition to the community, the academic opportunities and resources are unparalleled. We have incredible professors who are involved in student life and are always available to help. Finally, the extracurricular opportunities are fantastic. Regardless of your interest, there is something that will be related, and all clubs have very open membership policies. These policies help encourage exploration of interests outside the classroom. And makes study life awesome.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Niche User

Overall%20Experience.Review: The teachers and academic atmosphere are incredible. I feel very motivated every day; however, it can also create somewhat of a toxic environment, which fosters the duck syndrome. And that influences the student's mental health. Overall, the school is wonderful!
Overall%20Experience.Author: Junior

Overall%20Experience.Review: Loved my first year here, sun has kept me resilient to stress, and nice things to do in California. Not in a college town or big on the social scene but a great experience with peers and courses
Overall%20Experience.Author: Freshman

Overall%20Experience.Review: I don't think that my rating is necessarily fair. With just 11 weeks left in my sophomore year, my Stanford experience was irreparably altered. I did not have the opportunity to take a LOA, so for 1.33 years, my Stanford experience was decidedly, not a Stanford one. Online classes can be taken at any person's leisure, and I refuse the notion that the online experience is worth the price of tuition. That time in my life can never be taken back. My major declaration, my spring quarters, Junior Gala, dorm snow trips, time with friends, the bay area, all of it was just gone. That being said, this senior year of mine, has perhaps been the most magical out of anyone who could have ever attended the institution. I made it my mission to foster the most grandiose of communities. Sports, academics, people, friends, all of these things came rushing back, almost like it was my first time on the farm again. Don't get me wrong, I did it myself, but I couldn't have done it anywhere else.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Senior

Overall%20Experience.Review: I have enjoyed my stay here a lot. however, as a humanities major I feel that I am often overlooked at here because this is such a stem heavy school
Overall%20Experience.Author: Sophomore

Overall%20Experience.Review: I was admitted to Stanford Graduate School of Business for fall 2022. As for now, I haven't been to the campus and haven't attended any courses, but I assume attending Stanford must be a great experience.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Graduate Student

Overall%20Experience.Review: All the history I heard about this school was really amazing. The school is a very brilliant school although I haven't pay a visit or school there but I prefer to go if I have enough money to sponsor myself.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Niche User

Overall%20Experience.Review: Its been a really great program. Great resources. The campus is beautiful tooo! The campus is big so u need a bike.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Graduate Student

Overall%20Experience.Review: Great academics, great campus. I went on a tour of it, and it had a great campus and very willing to talk professors.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Niche User

Overall%20Experience.Review: Stanford University was a place i could see my son attending in the near future. The people were very informative on the questions that ny family had. The coaches were honest and confident in there knowledge of what they were looking for in a student athlete and laid out a plan for my sons future.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Niche User

Overall%20Experience.Review: Much I would change about my time, but Stanford set me up well to succeed early in my career, and the name and connections will open doors forver.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Alum

Overall%20Experience.Review: Overall, Stanford was a great place for someone who went in undecided. I ultimately chose to major in economics, but that was after I tried physics, computer science, and political science. The biggest downside right now is the social scene at Stanford is fairly non-existent with Greek life being cracked-down upon and new rules put in place by the administration.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Alum

Overall%20Experience.Review:
Now, 60+ years after a Stanford BSME, I am astoundingly grateful for a rounded undergraduate engineering education that led to 1) a succession of rewarding employments, and through those, 2) development of cultural appreciation and of language capability in Malaysian/Indonesian - employment experiences in human relations and communication that made me a more effective and versatile engineer.  So to Stanford, thanks for getting me off to a great start!
T. Savage, Seattle
Overall%20Experience.Author: Alum

Overall%20Experience.Review: Seeing the rankings of psychology with Stanford University being the top ones shocked me. I never thought Stanford would be so great with their psychology program and certainly didn't have them on my college list, but they're one of my tops schools to choose from.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Niche User

Overall%20Experience.Review: GREAT!                                                                                                                   .
Overall%20Experience.Author: Niche User

Overall%20Experience.Review: It's very difficult to get in but once you have been accepted, the system in place will do everything it can to help you succeed and earn that degree.  Being on the quarter system as opposed to semesters, the curriculum feels accelerated and it's easy to get left behind with even the slightest bit of inattentiveness.  It's a terrific school.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Alum

Overall%20Experience.Review: There are a lot of really unique classes that have an interdisiplinary take. FOr instance, I took a class with incarcerated artists at San Quentin Prison! Even though it's regarded as an academically rigorous school (which it is) a lot of the classes you can simply take for fun!
Overall%20Experience.Author: Freshman

Overall%20Experience.Review: Stanford is an excellent school, with superb academics and majors. The dorms are excellent and overall, Stanford has a very interactive environment!
Overall%20Experience.Author: Senior

Overall%20Experience.Review: Stanford was an incredible college experience. I had diverse classmates from all different walks of life to become life-long friends with. The academics were top notch, and the financial aid package was very generous for students who needed it. There are so many student organizations to be a part of, and the campus is absolutely beautiful. The school is in its own little bubble, however, so you have to bike to Palo Alto if you want to interact with people outside of academia.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Alum

Overall%20Experience.Review: Stanford is great, you will find your own community and your place since it's a very large school. Admin really encourages students to explore their own paths, think deeply about the most relevant problems in today's society, and be educated as a global citizen.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Senior

Overall%20Experience.Review: I thought it was a pretty great school. Very community-driven. I would like to see more resources for students who are struggling with online school.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Niche User

Overall%20Experience.Review: Wonderful people. Amazing professors. Great classes. It really is all it's hyped up to be. Although I haven't been on campus just yet (COVID), I already feel like I have a place at Stanford.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Freshman

Overall%20Experience.Review: Can't recommend it enough- a beautiful, challenging, and life changing place to begin higher education.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Alum

Overall%20Experience.Review: I love Stanford! Online classes are not ideal so kinda bummed to be missing out on the true stanford experience, but the profs are unmatched.

Overall%20Experience.Review: if you aint afraid to show your actions defenatly go to this college if you are intrested in theater
Overall%20Experience.Author: Graduate Student

Overall%20Experience.Review: Stanford University is the best university you might want to apply. Not only because of its name and selectiveness, but also because of the diversity that is only experienced at the campus. Their campus is the most diverse in the United States which makes it have a better student life.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Niche User

Overall%20Experience.Review: I love everything here. The architecture, the people, the atmosphere. The classes are a little difficult, but it's worth it.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Sophomore

Overall%20Experience.Review: I love Stanford and everything it has to offer. The people are so inspiring and I am excited to always be a part of the university.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Graduate Student

Overall%20Experience.Review:
There is no other university like it on the planet. The undergrad experience is fantastic--Stanford really makes sure to integrate first year students into campus life. 

Stanford does everything well: academics, extracurriculars, social scene, sports, food, the arts, improv comedy(!), etc. You name it, Stanford does it and does it brilliantly. It even has the best weather!

And don't forget about the grad programs. They are outstanding across the board.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Graduate Student

Overall%20Experience.Review: Excellent school. Your experience is what you make it. If your financial circumstances change be prepared for a lengthy battle with the financial aid office.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Graduate Student

Overall%20Experience.Review: It is a good school and I found a good community while I was there. There are a couple issues with some of the professors and departments heads and their lack of understanding.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Sophomore

Overall%20Experience.Review: Overall, Stanford is the perfect balance between excellent academics, athletics, and a social atmosphere. One of the most welcoming environments you will ever be in. What separates Stanford from some of its peer institutions is that even though it is an elite university, the students are not elitists in the slightest.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Sophomore

Overall%20Experience.Review:
The pluses: small class size; research opportunities; chance to get to know professors; excellent libraries; willingness to help students from different backgrounds; good overseas programs; good job hunting support. Good extracurricular activities (sports, music, drama). Wonderful if you already know where you want to go.
Negative: students determined to get that A!; inconsistent advising; special programs for students you might not hear about and might not be eligible for.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Senior

Overall%20Experience.Review: I'm a sophomore. I had some trouble freshman year, finding my people and deciding what I wanted to do â€“ but now I've found my place here and I love it so so much. While a lot of people love the freshman dorm experience, I'm more of a deep thinker / intellectual type at heart (sounds snobby but idk how else to say it) and my dorm culture largely revolved around partying, hookups, extraversion, small talk, and Instagram. It wasn't until Spring quarter that I found a solid group of friends (outside of my dorm) that I truly connected with. Then pre-sophomore year, during the SoCo program, I made more friends who I truly adore and have had the best times with â€“ smart, creative, hilarious, very grounded people. We baked cookies and made hot chocolate in the winter, drove to SF a few weekends in a row to hike the hills study over coffee and avocado toast. We study regularly in the library together, and stay up til 3am talking. Stanford feels like home, my friends and teachers like family.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Sophomore

Overall%20Experience.Review: For lack of better words, Stanford University is a one of a kind university. The cleanliness, architecture, art, and general energy of the campus are all of positivity, engagement, and other things of that sort. Whenever I am there, interacting with the students, faculty, and employees of the various stores and cafes there, it is a very, very welcoming environment. The bookstore has an amazing selection of books, and I always love looking at the selections of readings at its various libaries. Furthermore, every single interaction with professors that I have had, I have enjoyed them and am very much of the belief that they have been for the better. I am truly glad that I will be a part of the incoming Stanford class of 2024.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Freshman

Overall%20Experience.Review: Stanford has been an unforgettable experience so far! There are an unlimited number of resources for just about any concern or issue a student might face. Other students breathe new life into the campus on a daily basis with their fresh ideas and the faculty and staff are second to none!
Overall%20Experience.Author: Freshman

Overall%20Experience.Review: A lovely place with lovely people and a wonderful support for FLI students!! However, some classes feel a slight bit unorganized. In general, great financial aid and support.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Freshman

Overall%20Experience.Review: Just the absolute best. Had an amazing experience here and wouldn't have wanted to spend my time in college anywhere else.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Alum

Overall%20Experience.Review: I took an internship for the Stanford Daily. This was an eight-week internship with Stanford University's student newspaper. Every Monday I would experience a different workshop aimed at teaching key points of what should and shouldn't be done in different branches of journalism. These workshops would also teach you different skills such as graphics, photography, and other multimedia. Every week, I would sign up for an article and throughout the course of the week, I would receive feedback from an editor of the program.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Sophomore

Overall%20Experience.Review: Exceptional student body with a great and well-funded campus. The area around it is also great. You get a small-town vibe around it, but you are right next to a giant city, San Francisco, so you get the best of both worlds.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Niche User

Overall%20Experience.Review: Beautiful campus. Welcoming environment. Location and weather is amazing. Professors are truly interested in their students.  Great diversity in the student population.  Multiple interest groups from sports, arts, politics, service and much more. The exposure to alumni, industry leaders, celebrities, politicians, and regular people who are support and encouraging to expanding your learning is unmatched.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Alum

Overall%20Experience.Review: My undergraduate experience at Stanford University was rich and fulfilling.  I wish I could have stayed longer than the 4 years that I was there.  There is so much to offer and the academics are rigorous whether you are pursuing a degree in STEM or in the liberal arts, and there are an abundance of non-academic pursuits to follow as well, providing for a balanced student life.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Alum

Overall%20Experience.Review: This school is indeed at a very high level and will insure success for your child. There are many courses you can take and there are also a lot of extracurricular activities and clubs that you can join to enjoy our college life.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Niche User

Overall%20Experience.Review: Stanford's motto, "The wind of freedom blows," seems to permeate through all classroom walls, dorm rooms, and dining halls as students at this school are passionate, diligent, and lively. There is definitely a culture distinct to Stanford University, one which embodies free-spirited, unbounded learning. Aside from academics, though, I'd have to say that what makes Stanford unique is its people. Times when I've felt inspired, moved, and at home, were in moments I shared with others in discussions or conversations, whether it was academic or truly frivolous.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Freshman

Overall%20Experience.Review: I really love Stanford. It truly is the best place to be if you want to see academics in work and great athletics on the field
Overall%20Experience.Author: Freshman

Overall%20Experience.Review: Stanford is a fun place, their academics are good. Research is the main thing in university, and professors are helpful, don't have ego like some universities.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Freshman

Overall%20Experience.Review: As an institution, Stanford offers the best resources and opportunities. You can accomplish your craziest dreams: From creating a start-up, publishing a book, traveling, the school will help you with it. However, there is still poor support for the well-being of students (Mental health resources, sexual assault prevention, etc)
Overall%20Experience.Author: Junior

Overall%20Experience.Review: It confined me very well and everything was well organized. It has excellent ademics and excellent professors. Everyone there is kind nice and out going. The dorm that I got was clean and smelled nice when I first got there. I got buddy up with a sweat person she is very smart and helps me when I need it. I can go and walk to get food (campus food) and I know I am getting it for a goood price.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Niche User

Overall%20Experience.Review: Stanford is a great university. It has tons of research possibilities and I love that they support students to go study abroad. The campus is great in my opinion and Palo Alto is quite nice, being quiet and perfect for educational entities.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Niche User

Overall%20Experience.Review: I loved every aspect of my four years at Stanford, and have no complaints. Thanks to their generous financial aid, I was able to graduate college debt-free.

Overall%20Experience.Review: I visited the campus when I was in 7th grade, and the experience was surreal. The campus life  and focus on academics inspired my desire to attend Stanford University.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Senior

Overall%20Experience.Review: I like how big the college is and how beautiful the campus is. They have a lot of different majors to choose from. However the acceptance rate is very high.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Niche User

Overall%20Experience.Review: Am an exchange student in America and I always hear that it is a good university that everyone wishes to go to, this has made me to like it and have a dream of being there one day in my life.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Junior

Overall%20Experience.Review: Loved my campus visit and tour. I felt like a lot of questions were answered and it wasn't too big of a group.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Niche User

Overall%20Experience.Review: Love the campus so much! Always something going on here. Such a good learning environment. Beautiful buildings and nature.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Niche User

Overall%20Experience.Review: Everything you hear about Stanford is true. It is one of the best universities you can go to, and not just for the education, but the friendships you form along the way with like-minded individuals.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Graduate Student

Overall%20Experience.Review: Stanford is beautiful, full of opportunity and life and heart and soul. I'm excited to spend my undergraduate years here and I know it will be a transformative experience!
Overall%20Experience.Author: Freshman

Overall%20Experience.Review: It is a very good university. Love the are it's in with the smell of pine tree. The food is great there. There are different options to choose from. Everyone is kind there and people like to include others in activities and they have a nice library and stores to shop at.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Niche User

Overall%20Experience.Review: Stanford is the greatest place on earth. I feel so at home here and love everything about the campus and life here. The weather is amazing (no snow! or freezing temperatures), people are happier than many other schools, and you have the freedom and flexibility to study anything and switch your major around.

Overall%20Experience.Review: Stanford was a great place to sraudy with exceptional teachers and staff. Classes were hard at times but if you managed your time correctly then all was good. As a freshman I was scared at first but then if you open up you can make tons of new friends epecially if you join a sorority.

Overall%20Experience.Review: Stanford is the best university in the country having surpassed the likes of Harvard and Yale years ago. STEM is the future and no one can match Stanford's undergrad and graduate curriculum; additionally, Stanford is tops or near the top in many liberal arts concentrations. The gorgeous campus, amazing weather, school spirit, sports, and proximity to Silicon Valley and San Francisco are big bonuses. There is a good reason why students, parents, and counselors all name the school as their number one "Dream School."
Overall%20Experience.Author: Niche User

Overall%20Experience.Review: Great people and academics. Here you get very individualized support on a beautiful campus. I felt right at home as soon as I got here.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Freshman

Overall%20Experience.Review: Great institution with renowned faculty and elite sports. Palo Alto is a good location for startups/tech but not really a college town.

Overall%20Experience.Review: Excellent place with excellent people. Outstanding academics, not only in STEM fields but also less commonly known in humanities as well.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Freshman

Overall%20Experience.Review: Gotta be the best university in the country. Is there anything this school isn't good at????? Beautiful campus, lots of diversity, great reputation, amazing professors, could go on forever.

Overall%20Experience.Review: Stanford students have a reputation for working hard and playing hard. Explore these pages to meet student government leaders, future Olympians, talented artists, political activists, fraternity and sorority presidents, volunteers and avid Cardinal sports fans. More than 600 student organizations drive campus life.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Freshman

Overall%20Experience.Review: The only downside of Stanford is the party scene, and as someone who doesn't party, everything is perfect. The faculty, dorms/housing, and academics are world-class. The facilities are pristine, the campus is beautiful, and even the bathrooms are always clean. Stanford comes with its own prestige, so the return on investment should be great. Companies are always happy to hire someone with a Stanford background.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Freshman

Overall%20Experience.Review: Extremely nice campus, amazing programs, and the food there was incredible! The student-led campus tour was very informative as well!
Overall%20Experience.Author: Niche User

Overall%20Experience.Review: The student to teacher ratio is pretty good for such a big school. The ratio is one teacher to 18 students. Normally this might not be that good but when you consider that Stanford has some of the best teachers in the country, it makes up for the 18 students.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Junior

Overall%20Experience.Review: Currently, I'm just looking for scholarships to get into Stanford but as far as I've seen, its a great college. There is a lot of diversity, it opens great opportunities and its a great environment.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Niche User

Overall%20Experience.Review: Stanford is an amazing school in a not-so amazing area. The campus is big enough that you never have to leave, which is a positive and a negative thing. The negative thing is the creation of the "Stanford bubble"--you see the same people, eat the same food, go the same places all the time. But Palo Alto doesn't have much to offer, so it's nice that what we do need is close enough to walk to rather than having to go into the city.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Freshman

Overall%20Experience.Review: I wish Stanford would change their ways of gaining money, because scams aren't admirable. Overall, however, it's your typical school.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Niche User

Overall%20Experience.Review: While Stanford is a place to make great connections, it is not very diverse in the types of students and is not dedicated to making minority students feel cared about.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Junior

Overall%20Experience.Review: There is a beautiful campus; California weather and blue skies, amazing professors, academics, athletics, and facilities. Stanford is the perfect combination of everything you could want in a college- it prepares you for the real world, it's beautiful, the professors and classes are amazing, the facilities are great, and the athletics are unparalleled.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Freshman

Overall%20Experience.Review: Stanford University is a very beautiful campus and the staff and faculty are very nice and are willing to help students at all times. This is a very prestigious University and the biology labs, facilities, and professors live up to the hype and accolades of the school.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Niche User

Overall%20Experience.Review: The campus is beautiful to start and provides many beautiful areas for studying or hanging out with friends. The campus is full of amazing resources including the libraries and professors. The academics are definitely challenging, but worth it. You will be surrounded by people with similar interests and will only push you to work harder in and outside of the classroom.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Niche User

Overall%20Experience.Review: I love everything about Stanford. It's a very welcoming place and everyone you meet here is amazing. With such a diverse community, anyone will feel right at home here.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Freshman

Overall%20Experience.Review: the university is great, amazing lecturers and party scene. Good sports and facilities. campus food is amazing and this is the best experience I have had as a student
Overall%20Experience.Author: Alum

Overall%20Experience.Review: This place is moreover like a heaven for students. This is a awesome university. Professors are cooperative and staffs are lovely.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Niche User

Overall%20Experience.Review: Attending a pre-collegiate program at Stanford University was an amazing experience for me as I immersed myself completely into the atmosphere of the school and explored their many facilities and opportunities.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Niche User

Overall%20Experience.Review: The environment was calming and was beautiful. I enjoyed the research opportunities as well as the tutoring opportunities. The people seemed very friendly and the atmosphere overall was very enjoyable.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Niche User

Overall%20Experience.Review: Really welcoming when you first get there.The outside is beautiful and so are the dorm rooms.We have a great basketball team and we love to support them.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Niche User

Overall%20Experience.Review: It has amazing programs, and has a safe learning environment full of encouragement from your peers! Great place to go if you still don't know what you want to do while receiving the best education
Overall%20Experience.Author: Niche User

Overall%20Experience.Review: What I love about Stanford is the resources that it has especially for students who are first generation or low income. It has way more resources than many other colleges I know. One downfall of Stanford is its lack of diversity which is apparent not only in student demographics but also staff and professors. Another downfall of Stanford is its destructive relationship with neighboring communities especially cities like East Palo Alto where the population is largely low-income and non-White. Because of tech companies, the layout of Silicon Valley and Stanford's proximity to tech companies, many families are being displaced by recent Stanford grads and other related workers.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Sophomore

Overall%20Experience.Review: The campus is beautiful to start and provides many beautiful areas for studying or hanging out with friends. The campus is full of amazing resources including the libraries and professors. The academics are definitely challenging, but worth it. Go Card!
Overall%20Experience.Author: Alum

Overall%20Experience.Review: Stanford provides a world-class academic setting in a diverse enriching community. It provides with opportunities and experiences to last a lifetime.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Junior

Overall%20Experience.Review: Stanford is an amazing school. I just finished my freshman year, and I had almost all classes under 25 students; lectures all break into sections of 15 students or so. Great people, great professors. More diversity than I had ever encountered in my life until now. Oh, and the weather is beautiful too.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Sophomore

Overall%20Experience.Review: I loved the campus and the atmosphere that the individuals created there. The staff assisted me to their fullest potential while touring the campus and its amenities.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Niche User

Overall%20Experience.Review: A lot of what I expected college to be like came from TV, but arriving at Stanford proved a lot of the cliches wrong. My fears of cramped dorm rooms, dreadful dining hall food, and a drab campus were fully put to rest within my first week of moving in. Beyond that, there has not been a single class that has not enlightened me in some way. The professors are amazing, and their passion for the subject matter is clearly visible throughout every lecture. When your professors are the best in their field, and when they approach every class with the high energy that comes with loving what they're teaching, it's almost impossible to not fall in love with the subject yourself.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Sophomore

Overall%20Experience.Review: Amazing School overall. The best of the best program, with prestigious opportunities coming out of school.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Niche User

Overall%20Experience.Review: I love Stanford. There are so many opportunities and resources here for every student, even those with financial need like myself. Moreover, there is a diverse student body that always provides insights on something new and constantly challenge you to be your best.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Sophomore

Overall%20Experience.Review: My experience at Stanford has really made me somebody excited about being a life long learner. I have enjoyed every single person I have met, and learned so much from them and the professors that have such a diversity of backgrounds and knowledge.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Senior

Overall%20Experience.Review: Great place. I was very fortunate to go there. It's like summer camp for 4 years. Best place ever and it gets better every year.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Alum

Overall%20Experience.Review: The application process was easy to understand. The campus is beautiful, and they even provided a travel scholarship for me to fly to visit the campus.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Freshman

Overall%20Experience.Review: Generally a great place to go to school, very easy to connect with faculty. Students are generally happy, and when they are not, there is ample discussion about the importance of mental health and of taking care of the self.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Senior

Overall%20Experience.Review: I liked how the campus has a children's hospital or a hospital in general. It shows how the university is very prevalent in ensuring the medical bound students their success by putting them in the medical environment.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Works Here

Overall%20Experience.Review: Stanford is a private school that costs a lot to attend. But it comes with smaller classes, good professors, and a good overall feel of the school.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Niche User

Overall%20Experience.Review: Excellent area to visit and hear about their history.  Facility, especially aquatics, is amazing and can be hosted for many professional events.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Niche User

Overall%20Experience.Review: I will always love Stanford for the memories and the people I have met. Stanford, in many ways, is amazing--sunny all the time and a campus out of a magazine. What's special about attending an "elite" institution is the number of opportunities available--funding for projects, opportunities to travel for free, opportunities for publication, opportunities to work with leaders in your field and more. If you're looking for opportunity, you will find it at Stanford. What sucks about Stanford is probably what sucks at any other private institution in the country: change is slow, it seems like administrators don't care what students think or want, the financial aid department can ruin your day, there are a ton entitled white, rich kids here who pretend like they're not entitled, white rich kids.  STEM will always have more opportunities than other fields; the influence of Silicon valley is prevalent.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Senior

Overall%20Experience.Review: I frequented Stanford University's campus in Palo Alto, CA since close familial acquaintances attended Stanford. Additionally, as I attended elementary and middle school in PAUSD, I have taken various summer program and participated in activities held at Stanford. From my experiences, Stanford is a warm, welcoming school with a beautiful campus and considerate student body.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Niche User

Overall%20Experience.Review: Amazing. If given the chance, choose this school. The amount of activities and liveliness of the university provided a relaxing sensation despite having to work intensely and be challenged by classes. The classes themselves are also rather intense, and you do need to seek out assistance, and there are plenty of resources available for such.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Alum

Overall%20Experience.Review: I love the atmosphere around campus! You meet someone inspiring every day with an incredible story to share.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Sophomore

Overall%20Experience.Review: I am a current freshman and love this place. The people are all so friendly and everyone genuinely wants you to fit in and love the Farm.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Freshman

Overall%20Experience.Review: The overall experience at stanford is great, few things that I would like to recommend for a change are housing and campaigning food
Overall%20Experience.Author: Graduate Student

Overall%20Experience.Review: Stanford University is a very lovely college. I went on a visit and they were very attentive and they got interested in what I wanted to do someday and they told me everything I could do with it there and what buildings I would go to. They paved out everything I could want to know and made everything so simple to understand. They had amazing facilities and everyone was so welcoming. They try very hard at everything they do. It would be a great place to go for an aspiring athlete or scholar.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Niche User

Overall%20Experience.Review: It is truly a great experience ! best university in the world , you will have great opportunities and friends.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Niche User

Overall%20Experience.Review: Overall fun and good time. Lots of work. Good for most people. Freshman year was amazing. Sophomore year is time to buckle down and grind like most places.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Sophomore

Overall%20Experience.Review: Stanford is a beautiful, welcoming place where everyone is welcome! There is an overwhelming sense of community to be found by anyone from any background, and academics are challenging and prepare you for anything you may want to pursue after college. The atmosphere and school spirit are always lively, and it's an overall great place to be.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Freshman

Overall%20Experience.Review: When I toured the Stanford Campus I fell in love with the accepting and kind student body, as well as the learning culture an environment present at this prestigious academy.  My guide was very accommodating and encouraged us to ask all of our questions.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Niche User

Overall%20Experience.Review: I love Stanford! The student atmosphere lives up to collaborative hype, the weather is beautiful, and all the classes are taught by professors that have a true passion for the subject.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Freshman

Overall%20Experience.Review: Stanford is a great school because it has a lot of resources and connections. I don't think the academics are harder than any other university, but I think they do a great job in selecting students who have a passion for discovery, creation, and innovation. The experience of being able to learn, grow, and collaborate with these people is the greatest blessing.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Junior

Overall%20Experience.Review: Stanford has endless opportunities to pursue personal and intellectual growth. The resources and improvement-minded attitude provide motivation and support towards the student experience.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Junior

Overall%20Experience.Review: I just finished my freshman year and have had a wonderful time at Stanford. It's a place where you can be yourself and there will be a welcoming place for you. Classes are top-notch. Student life is diverse, and there are many students who are highly smart yet also down-to-earth and unpretentious about it. It's important, however, to keep in mind that Stanford isn't the perfect palm tree academic paradise its brochures try to make it out to be. There are virtually no good food options on campus, and it's quite hard to get off it. Despite being a diverse place, students often go into their little communities, and those often rarely interact. Stanford admin can oscillate between launching programs that are very welcoming to students, and paying lip service to other issues that are important to students. Overall, if you get in, it's definitely cause for celebration. However, if you don't, it's not  like you've missed your one golden chance. Really, don't sweat it too much.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Sophomore

Overall%20Experience.Review: I loved the campus at Stanford and the fact that they have their own little city on campus. I think the students who attend are all very unique in their personalities and hobbies, which makes the student body particularly diverse.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Niche User

Overall%20Experience.Review: A truly unique school that has a great balance of social, academic, and athletic capacities. Wouldn't want to be anywhere else.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Sophomore

Overall%20Experience.Review: Stanford has afforded me the opportunity to explore who I am as an aspiring science researcher, and given me great and numerous free opportunities to get involved with events both on and off of campus, fun and academic alike.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Freshman

Overall%20Experience.Review: Stanford offers a great number of majors, and with a beautiful campus and high end resources to boot, it makes sense why so many want to go there. But considering the issues with their application  process and how it wrongfully denies applicants' credit cards as invalid (including mine) I would not be surprised if many great minds wasted their time applying here as I have.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Niche User

Overall%20Experience.Review: Stanford is a place of innovation. Improvements are constantly made to the school. It's easy to make connections with faculty. Since most undergraduates live on campus, it's easy to meet up with friends for meals and visit each others' dorms. The weather is terrific. You can take any class and be any major you want.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Alum

Overall%20Experience.Review: The campus is beautiful, the food is amazing, the people are incredible. Stanford is the only place I can see myself being and growing. However, their financial aid policy is complete nonsense. So many people I know are having difficulties or are taking leaves because the school is in no way accommodating.
Overall%20Experience.Author: Freshman

Overall%20Experience.Review: Stanford University is one of the most beautiful schools I have ever seen, it is filled with an academic auora that undeniably present. It is campus friendly and provides a safe unit for the students. It has caused major drive on incoming freshman and allowed them to feel welcome and make them want to come to such an outrageous school. The amount of respect and title Stanford holds should live up to it, and it sure does. Stanford University is one of the most beautiful campuses I have ever seen and every student is lucky to have the opportunity to go to such an outstanding, academically successful school.
